page.title: 05CORNALEES INFORMATION CENTRE
page.content: THE INFORMATION CENTRE AT CORNALEES BRIDGE HOUSES THE RANGERS OFFICE, TOILETS, AND A DISPLAY ABOUT THE AREA. THERE IS ALSO A CAR PARK, AND PICNIC TABLES. CORNALEES BRIDGE COUNTRY PARK IS ONLY ONE PART OF A MUCH LARGER REGIONAL PARK WHICH STRETCHES FROM LUNDERSTON BAY (A BEACH AERA BETWEEN INVERKIP AND GOUROCK) TO MUIRSHIEL COUNTRY PARK AND CASTLE SEMPLE WATER PARK-BOTH NEAR LOCHWINNOCH. THE CENTRE EMPLOYS 4 RANGERS WHOSE MAIN JOBS IS PROVIDING AN INFORMATION SERVICE FOR VISITORS, BUT ALSO GIVING GUIDED TOURS AND TALKS ABOUT PLANT AND WILDLIFE IN THE PARK. THE BUSIEST TIMES OF THE YEAR TEND TO BE DURING SPRING AND SUMMER- MAY AND JUNE MAINLY WITH SCHOOL VISITS; JULY AND AUGUST BEING CONCERNED WITH
